title: Multiple failed authentication attempts from same IPs — possible password spray / brute force
description: There are clusters of repeated authentication failures (including 'Strong Authentication is required' and 'Invalid username or password' / 'Invalid password') from the same source IPs against multiple accounts over short windows — consistent with automated credential guessing or password spray attempts. Some attempts eventually result in successful sign-ins from the same IPs or nearby addresses.

mitre.description: Brute-force / password spraying attempts against Azure AD accounts to gain valid credentials.

log_lines: 2025-09-03 05:15:56.918961+00:00,72c63eaa9ead4ac33e1e4c506972124fc140b5491689382b094be3804e920ab1@lognpacific.com,Sign-in activity,SignInLogs,FAILURE,Invalid password, entered expired password.,Azure Portal,134.22.173.122

2025-09-04 03:27:31.751506+00:00,667e503b5c6895297d79a49dbe21b8b53a147fb504da9e93cb9cd03ff65d7336@lognpacific.com,Sign-in activity,SignInLogs,FAILURE,Invalid username or password or Invalid on-premise username or password.,Azure Portal,195.179.201.38

2025-09-04 03:27:56.980563+00:00,667e503b5c6895297d79a49dbe21b8b53a147fb504da9e93cb9cd03ff65d7336@lognpacific.com,Sign-in activity,SignInLogs,FAILURE,Invalid username or password or Invalid on-premise username or password.,Azure Portal,195.179.201.38
indicators_of_compromise: Indicators in ResultDescription: 'Invalid username or password', 'Invalid password, entered expired password', 'Strong Authentication is required.'
notes: Many 'Strong Authentication is required' failures may be conditional access / MFA prompts; however presence of 'Invalid password' / repeated failures from single IPs supports credential-guessing hypothesis. Correlate with Conditional Access and Azure AD Identity Protection telemetry (risk events) and source ASN/abuse reports for the IPs.

title: Rapid failure→success sequence for account 8f6f15e1... from same IP — suspected credential abuse or session bypass
description: Account 8f6f15e1... shows a sequence of failures immediately followed by a SUCCESS from the same IP (136.226.2.168) within minutes. Failure messages include 'Keep me signed in' interrupt and 'Strong Authentication is required', then a success — could indicate successful credential guessing, session replay, or an interactive user who resolved MFA. Requires investigation.

mitre.description: Use of valid credentials (possibly obtained via guessing or compromise) to sign in.

indicators_of_compromise: ResultDescriptions showing both repeated failures and eventual success
notes: Confirm whether these successes correspond to legitimate user activity (contact user, check MFA prompts). If not, consider forcing a password reset and revoking active sessions for the account. Investigate source IP ownership and check for known VPN / proxy usage.

title: Impossible travel — same account (fa26fa6581a7be44...) signs in from Virginia (US) then Perth (AU) within ~8 minutes
description: Account fa26fa6581a7be442a8f55bf731eb8d011db9365... has successful sign-ins from Glen Allen, VA (2600:4040:aae8:bf00:...) at 2025-09-04 00:51:55Z and then from Perth, Australia (96.0.0.122) at 2025-09-04 01:00:02Z — an ~8 minute interval across continents. This is a strong indicator of account misuse (session/token replay, proxied access, or compromised credentials).

mitre.description: Use of valid credentials from disparate geographies — may enable further access and lateral movement.

notes: High-confidence impossible travel. Recommended immediate actions: disable user's sessions, require password reset + MFA re-enrollment, check recent admin/API activity, audit mailbox/app access, and check other sign-ins from the Perth IP for additional compromised accounts.

title: Repeated 'Invalid password / expired password' failures followed by success — targeted account compromise candidate
description: Several user entries show 'Invalid password, entered expired password.' multiple times then a successful authentication from the same IP range (example: e9eb9c57... and 72c63eaa...). This pattern is consistent with an attacker trying expired or commonly used passwords and eventually authenticating (or a legitimate user correcting credentials after failures).

mitre.description: Password guessing / spraying resulting in eventual successful authentication.

log_lines: 2025-09-04 00:56:05.722323+00:00,e9eb9c57a17394a74e175102806141b258969774eb69db321c91b813d3e09dfc@lognpacific.com,Sign-in activity,SignInLogs,FAILURE,"Invalid password, entered expired password.",Azure Portal,192.145.118.15

2025-09-03 05:15:56.918961+00:00,72c63eaa9ead4ac33e1e4c506972124fc140b5491689382b094be3804e920ab1@lognpacific.com,Sign-in activity,SignInLogs,FAILURE,Invalid password, entered expired password.,Azure Portal,134.22.173.122
notes: If these are service accounts or privileged accounts, escalate immediately. Otherwise verify user activity and consider forcing password reset and session revocation.
